title: Is there a way to reinstall League using the file?
body: So, I got a new laptop and reimaged my old one. I saved my files, including the Riot Games file created when you've installed League. I reinstalled League and dumped the back-up files into the new folder but the client won't boot up. Is there a proper way to do so or do I need to reinstall the whole thing?

replies.body: It is possible. I know a cousin of mine who copied all the file from his computer and placed in my computer and it worked perfectly (but you have to update it ) unfortunately I don't know how he did it. Possibly coping it and pasting it into the folders where the league client gets its data used from.

yes there is!! copy the entire LoL files onto a usb and then go to the LoL website on your new PC. install the game but do not run it. replace all the files from C/RiotGames/LeaugeOfLedgends and off you go :)
Uninstall and re-install from the LoL website. Unfortunately your individualised setting will need to be done again by hand.

Its probably easier (and better) to download a fresh copy, especially if you havent cleared your Riot Games folder in a while. The game is only 4-5 GB. Whereas most people have 20GB +  folders from all the updates and stuff.
